bibl.title: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to [Emma Coleman Carter], [18--]

div1.p: Carter describes his current hospital work.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to [Emma Coleman Carter], [18--]
div1.p:
I would like to look in on you all,
Carter is home from Aspen Hill, How
little change, some among the people, there
is with us in Va. How is Mr. Kemper? (Old C. G.)
& who is at Aspen Hill now & at Brookes
place & Cuckoo? It is probably not colder
In with you than with us just now, although
we have a few Oranges hanging still,
I have had some cases giving me
much anxiety lately - fairly satisfac-
tory but anxious cases - one, a boy with Typhoid
Fever, is still quite ill, but I hope (& rather
think today) will recover.

I get a much better class of patients
than I did at first & the hospital is popular,
In lieu of getting one deposit of money in
six weeks as formerly. I have 73 recor-
ded since July 1st, several watches etc, showing
a better class of men, never have any trou-
ble about the discipline of patients, no grumbling
grumbling &, few complaints & yet frequent-
ly requests for more or different things to
eat showing that they are not afraid to

ask or complain if need be. I have
a case of Sarapotomy. (ask Mr Read what
that is) for Monday, which will be the 2d since
July 1st. I have the normal amount of
worry with the custodian business however,
I find in the total number treated (office &
hospital). In O, is the 3d largest, while in
hospital alone it is only the 6th, still a big
part & if I had room I could certainly get
100 more a year of foreign seamiese,
I hope that I am satisfied, or almost
satisfied with my work - the word
means (I do enough), but it isn't a very
(Facio Satis)
pleasant life - host ways at times, not
that I care a great deal about that, because
I know well that, leaving out pain,
most lives are pleasant or not, accor-
ding as one takes things.

L, whose cake is rising now, sends her love
& the trash would were they not asleep.
I always want to hear of Jun.Dey
